definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if

sentences.english: The style was hurried, the tone intemperate .
sentences.chinese: 匆促的筆調，放縱的語氣。

sentences.english: Don’t overindulge in the comforts of home.
sentences.chinese: 不要過度放縱在家裏的安逸中。

sentences.english: We must keep away excessive lavish and .
sentences.chinese: 我們必須避免過分放縱和鋪張浪費。

sentences.english: Chicago had a free-and-easy atmosphere much like that of Storyville.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥有一種很象斯托裏維爾那樣自由和放縱的氣氛。

sentences.english: Absence from those we love is self from self a deadly banishment.
sentences.chinese: 脫離情人就是自我解脫，極度地放縱。

sentences.english: The more service to Jesus the less self_indulgent.
sentences.chinese: 越多服事基督，越少放縱自己。

sentences.english: A binge day is one day where you can eat whatever you want.
sentences.chinese: 放縱的這一天你可以喫任何你想要的東西。

sentences.english: It also helps you avoid cravings and overindulging .
sentences.chinese: 它也幫助你避免偏食和放縱開懷。

sentences.english: I swear I caught a look of unbridled ecstasy on his furry little face as he dug his Lilliputian hands into the sugar and shoveled it into his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我發誓看到了它在用小手抓糖送到口裏時的放縱狂喜。

sentences.english: When you spend time having fun, you know you're being self-indulgent.
sentences.chinese: 當你花時間享樂時，你知道你在放縱自己。

sentences.english: I was intemperate in my youth.
After all your hard work you can reward yourself with one binge day per week.
sentences.chinese: 在你辛苦計劃之後你可以每週放縱一天獎勵自己。

sentences.english: But in the U.S., affluence did not lead to indulgence and decline.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在美國，富裕並沒有使它走向放縱與衰落。

sentences.english: So next time you’re looking for a virtuous indulgence, think of the honeybees.
sentences.chinese: 所以下次當你尋找一種有益的放縱的話，想想蜂蜜吧。

sentences.english: Not in the lust of concupiscence, even as the Gentiles which know not God
sentences.chinese: 不放縱私慾的邪情，像那不認識神的外邦人。

sentences.english: Reward yourself with one binge day per week.
sentences.chinese: 每週放縱一天獎勵自己。

definition: to control/to restrict/to moderate/to temper/moderation/sobriety/to administer
confident and at ease/free and easy
to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
character acquired through long habit/habits and properties
to follow one's heart's desires/to do as one pleases (idiom)
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
